query: (data analyst OR data scientist) site:linkedin.com/jobs/view/ (Singapore OR SG)

jobs.title: Data Scientist
jobs.about_us: An exciting Data Scientist job opportunity has become available at a well-known technology organisation.
jobs.job_description: About the Data Scientist Role: This company is a leading technology solutions provider with over 50 years of existence. They are looking to hire a Data Scientist who will report to the Head of Data. Key Responsibilities: Implementing and identifying various machine learning techniques along with designing analytic solutions Working on large sets of data and participating in various data exploration activities Helping the team in creating algorithms and improve data collection procedures Working with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, understand business processes and conduct data cleansing in order to enable data visualisation to stakeholders.
jobs.job_requirements: To succeed in this Data Scientist role, you will need to have around five years of experience. Key Requirements: Bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science, or equivalent Five years of experience in ML data modelling Experience in BI and data mining Hands-on experience in Python, R, Java and Scala Experience in Hadoop and ETL tools Prior experience working in an agile environment.

jobs.title: Market Research Data Analyst
jobs.location: Central Singapore Community Development Council, Singapore
jobs.about_us: Agility Research & Strategy is currently looking for a dynamic candidate to fill this position. Our team is a diverse group of talented individuals that come from a range of backgrounds, Our DNA is agile, intelligent, self-starters who are keen to grow and learn. Working with the C suite of the world's leading Premium and Luxury brands, this role gives the right individual an opportunity to help these brands with our proven methodologies and solutions. We are looking for a data and research analyst who is able to translate data into summaries and can do analysis with conclusions that deliver on objectives and support proactive insights and recommendations. The role will include writing creative reports for premium brands and looking at data from various sources including survey data and big data sources like social media.
jobs.job_description: For this role, you will need at least a bachelor's degree in marketing research or a related discipline like statistics or maths. And experience with different data sources and reports. Atleast 4 to 7 years of experience with data and analysis.
jobs.job_requirements:
Education & Experience
4-7 years’ experience in working with multiple data set
Self-motivated with high ethical standards, able to work independently and as a team.
Proven ability to meet strict deadlines and maintain timelines and calendars.
Ability to work in a fast-paced and constantly changing environment.
Capable of thinking outside the box and generating creative ideas.

What Soft Skills Do You Need?

Verbal Communication: Good speaking skills will allow you to present the results of your research to clients and colleagues.
Listening: Strong listening skills are essential to understanding your clients' needs and the scope of the projects on which you are working.
Writing: You must be able to present written reports of your research.
Reading Comprehension: You will have to be able to understand a large number of documents, including research reports and survey responses.
Critical Thinking: As a marketing research analyst, you will have to decide between different strategies to market products. Your ability to compare and contrast different approaches to make an educated decision is essential.
Problem Solving: You must be able to detect problems, and come up with solutions.
Analytical Skills: Your research will yield a lot of data that you must be able to analyze, understand, and from which you must draw conclusions. This part of your job will also require you to be detail oriented.
skills: Working With Different Data Sources Like Survey And Social Media Data

jobs.title: Team Lead - Data Analyst / Scientist
jobs.about_us: NE Digital - Our Centre of Excellence for Data, Digitalization and Technology was setup to lead the transformation of the NTUC Social Enterprises by leveraging digital technologies to become more nimble, adaptable and innovative in today’s digital age. Our group of social enterprises aims to create a greater social force to do good by harnessing the capabilities of the social enterprises to meet pressing social needs in areas like health and eldercare, childcare, daily essentials, cooked food and financial services. Serving over two million customers, NE Digital together with our group of social enterprises will enable and empower all in Singapore to live better and more meaningful lives through our transformation journey. The Team We believe that diversity is key to driving an innovative, cohesive, productive and fun workplace! Hence, at NE Digital our people join us from all around the world. Be sure to be soaked in an environment with different ethnic groups driving innovation and injecting some creative juice as one! Contributing to a social purpose through technology, our team of passionate and dedicated folks are spread into different social enterprises such as NTUC Fairprice Group, NTUC First Campus, NTUC Health and among others! Creating technologies that impact!
jobs.job_description: NE Digital is currently hiring for Team Lead to join the Partnership Analytics team supporting NTUC Link which operates Plus!, one of Singapore’s leading loyalty and rewards programs that connects over 2 million members to merchants offering everyday deals across online and offline channels. A key component in Link’s digital transformation is the use of tech and data analytics to track, understand, model and personalize the customer journey for Plus! members. This position will be reporting directly to Head of Marketing Analytics. The Partnership analytics team supports and drives the business growth for 10-15 top key merchants in the Plus! Ecosystem. In addition to that, the candidate should have some managing experience and interest to work with CRM data to translate data from raw form to insights to drive marketing budget to be optimized on the right things. This position is tasked with executing a mix of data science and data analytics, geared towards i) delivering actionable insights to aid business strategy; ii) developing predictive models to increase customer engagement and personalize communications. You should be proficient in the application of data science on customer transaction and campaign data, and a variety of semi-structured/unstructured data, to produce solutions in areas such as customer segmentation and targeting, lookalike modeling, item recommendation.
jobs.job_requirements:
Bachelor or Masters in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Physics, Economics, Knowledge Engineering, Data Analytics, or a related quantitative field.
Solid understanding of statistical analysis, machine learning and experimental design.
Proficiency in SQL and either Python or R.
Hands on experience with development of end-to-end data analytics solutions including data exploration/crawling, model building and performance evaluation.
Team player who can build strong partnerships and collaborations with the business.
Experience communicating complex data and insight to business audience.
Creative problem-solving skills, to identify pain points, conceptualize solution while balance complexity and effort in process & technology changes.
Familiarity with BI and visualization tools like Tableau/Qlik/Power BI.
Prior working experience with Salesforce data or working knowledge of translating CRM tools data to insightful products is an advantage.
Experience interfacing with cloud platforms like GCP/AWS is an advantage.

jobs.title: Head of APAC Data Science
jobs.about_us: Empower is shaking up an outdated financial system by providing real opportunity for our customers: the opportunity to get the cash they need, to access fair credit, and to change their financial story. Today, we’re helping millions of people find financial security through machine learning models that evaluate creditworthiness using a more inclusive lens and mobile-first products: Cash Advance, Thrive line of credit, and Petal credit cards. Tomorrow? Creating even more financial paths for our customers (and their wallets) to succeed. This year, Empower ranked #65 on Inc. 5000’s Fastest-Growing Private Companies list — our third year in a row cracking the top 100 — and was named by Forbes as one of the 25 Next Billion-Dollar Startups for 2024. Empower was also featured by Forbes on America’s Best Startup Employers list in 2023, and our Thrive line of credit product was named by Fast Company as one of 2022’s Next Big Things in Tech. Empower is backed by Sequoia Capital, Blisce, and Icon Ventures. Ready to grow your impact and accelerate your career? Take a look at our open roles — we can’t wait to meet you.
jobs.job_description: The Opportunity: Head of APAC Data Science Empower is looking for an experienced data scientist to join our fintech startup and lead the Data Science team for our emerging business in APAC. This role presents an exciting opportunity to be an early team member as we build a winning strategy. As part of the Credit and Data Science team, you will develop and iterate on risk models and credit policies that drive underwriting as a competitive advantage for Empower and launch innovative products that solve customer problems. This role will report to Empower’s Head of International Credit. The ideal candidate is driven by a passion for leveraging data and analytics to fuel business growth and improve customer financial well-being. This individual will lead teams and workstreams that seek to understand consumer needs and behaviors and develop solutions to allow Empower to resiliently offer the right products. This role involves the additional challenge of solving problems for a new geographies for Empower where frameworks will need to be adapted based on the available data and customer needs. The right candidate thrives on tackling complex challenges and is proficient in utilizing a wide range of technical tools to achieve impactful outcomes. How You'll Make an Impact Build new underwriting models from scratch for Empower’s international businesses owning each part of the model deployment process Collaborate closely with Credit and Finance stakeholders to ensure the work drives meaningful business outcomes Build out frameworks, infrastructure, and controls to build, retrain, and deploy models with speed and high quality Work with Empower’s leadership team to build out strategy and growth plans while managing financial outcomes Partner with leaders in product, engineering, marketing, and finance to ensure that our data science solutions fit within the larger picture Lead current team and build out a larger team to staff new projects as the businesses grow.
jobs.job_requirements: Why You're a Great Fit You're passionate about using data science to solve meaningful problems. You thrive in collaborative environments and enjoy turning data into solutions that make a difference in people's lives. You’re excited by the challenge of working in new markets, where frameworks must be adapted to fit local data and customer needs. Your Experience Likely Includes Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Business, Finance, Computer Science, or Mathematics 8+ years of industry experience in machine learning, statistical analysis, and/or predictive modeling with deep understanding of statistics and machine learning techniques, including regression, classification, clustering and optimization Strong skills Python and SQL; demonstrable experience with ML packages: scikit-learn, LightGBM, XGBoost, SparkML, etc. 4+ years working in financial services 2+ years leading a team of data scientists Preferred: Experience solving credit problems in Latin American or APAC markets Eagerness to learn new tools and analytical methods, staying up to date with innovative trends and methodologies in the industry Exceptionally strong problem solving and communication with the ability to both get in the weeds and communicate to an executive audience.

jobs.title: Economist/Data Scientist
jobs.job_description: You will be part of a team of Economists/Data Scientists involving in research and ascertain emerging issues to inform policy formulation while conveying findings in accessible, visual forms to engage the public more effectively. You will also be responsible in undertaking secretariat work to support the process of identifying emerging topics to be studied by the data analytics unit within the Economics Division (ECD). In your role, you will be formulating strategies and conducting analysis for assigned topics while working closely with the project manager and the Corporate Communication Division Team to convey findings ahead of key events.
jobs.job_requirements:
Degree/Masters/PhD in a quantitative discipline: Economics, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Engineering, or related disciplines.
1 to 2 years of experience in software programming or relevant work experience in technical field.
Strong passion for empirical research and extensive experience solving complex problems using quantitative approaches.
Keen sense in value of data and translation of business objectives into actionable analysis.
Experience working with large real-time datasets.
Good analytical and presentation skills to communicate complex quantitative analysis with clarity and precision.

jobs.title: Data Scientist
jobs.about_us: At GSK, we have already delivered unprecedented change over the past four years, improving R&D, becoming a leader in Consumer Healthcare, strengthening our leadership, and transforming our commercial execution. Now, we’re making the most significant changes we’ve made to our business in over 20 years. We’re on track to separate and create two new companies in 2022: New GSK with a leading portfolio of vaccines and specialty medicines as well as R&D based on immune system and genetics science; and a new world-leading consumer healthcare company of loved and trusted brands. With new ambition comes new purpose. For New GSK, this is to unite science, talent, and technology to get ahead of disease together – all with the clear ambition of delivering human health impact; stronger and more sustainable shareholder returns; and as a new GSK where outstanding people thrive. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it. How we do all this is through our people and our culture. A culture that is ambitious for patients – so we deliver what matters better and faster; accountable for impact – with clear ownership of goals and support to succeed; and where we do the right thing. So, if you’re ready to improve the lives of billions, join us at this exciting moment in our journey. Join our challenge to get Ahead Together. GSK Commercial We prevent and treat disease with vaccines and specialty and general medicines. We focus on the science of the immune system, human genetics, and advanced technologies, investing in four core therapeutic areas (Infectious Disease, HIV, Oncology, and Immunology/ Respiratory) and future opportunities to impact health at scale. We have a broad portfolio of innovative and established medicines that treat everything from COPD to lupus and urology, as well as vaccines that help protect people at all stages of life. We are a global leader in respiratory disease and HIV, and we’re developing our presence in specialty therapy areas, including oncology and immuno-inflammation. We deliver over 20 different vaccines in more than 160 countries. From smallpox to meningitis and influenza, our vaccines have been protecting people from some of the world’s most devastating diseases for more than 100 years, and we’re continuing to develop novel vaccines across a range of pressing public health threats. Our goal is to be one of the world’s most innovative, best performing and trusted healthcare companies. We believe that we all bring something unique to GSK and when we combine our knowledge, experiences and styles together, the impact is incredible. Come join our adventure at GSK where you will be inspired to do your best work for our patients and consumers. A place where you can be you, feel good and keep growing.
jobs.job_description: Provide advanced analytics capabilities to the team around the channels and systems in scope include paid and social media, websites and personalisation, audience segmentation and management, experimentation and analytics, 1st party customer and visitor data management, and attribution and marketing mix model collaboration. Support Digital Marketing and Program Management Lead as a key influencer and leader across the organisation, regularly interacting with CEP Global Marketing leadership team, Pharma Tech, GPMO and Regional commercial operation teams to set the vision and requirements needed to support new capabilities. Continuously to identity industry leading data analytics opportunities and provide key requirements into Pharma Tech around the data and systems required for an optimal omni-channel marketing, optimisation, and customer experience (content personalisation). Responsibilities: Oversees complex data analysis with multiple data sets (internal and external to GSK databases/systems) to inform senior leadership decision making and action. Responsible for setting up unified source of truth, dashboards that drive optimisation of campaigns. Assesses digital marketing data and systems and identifies risks and opportunities to enhance capability development. Identifies inefficiencies in data-to-decision processes across digital analytics, personalisation, business intelligence, and experimentation domains and recommends solutions to improve. Partner with Technology and Data stakeholders to evaluate data environments and develop roadmaps to close gaps. Determine priorities of the digital marketing data ecosystem within the data systems & architecture. Ensure data is readily available to support metrics and models; promote cohesive and integrated decision-making with the department. Identify data required to build and enhance customer profiles and customer behavioral models. This may include licensing 2nd and 3rd party digital data. Ensures data usage meets privacy policies and industry compliance and regulatory requirements, e.g. strong understanding of GDPR. Adheres to governance rigor of existing data mart processes, procedures, controls, standards, tools and templates (as required).
jobs.job_requirements: The job holder needs to be a self-driven and organised individual with strong data analytics skills in order to deliver the value of data analytics. Bachelor’s Degree in Quantitative field e.g. Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Economics. 3 to 5 years of experience in advanced and predictive data analytics and modelling. Ability to extract large volumes of multifaceted data using SQL with experience of the common data management system. Demonstrable programming ability in different languages (R and Python are essential). Advanced Excel skills required (e.g. VBA) – can demonstrate efficient application of mathematical concepts and programming to improve efficiency of modelling and reporting. Experience of analytic and BI tools such as Power BI, Qlik, and similar applications. Predictive and prescriptive analytics and ability to innovate the current ways of working by pushing the boundaries. Demonstrable experience with interchange data and other data / data platform preferred. Courageous to explore & connect external world data sets with the internal world to deliver meaningful insights without fear of failure. Analytics experience in applying statistical solutions to solving business problems is desirable. Hands on experience in processing extremely large data sets. Self-driven, high curiosity to learn and resolve problem with innovation, and out-of-the-box thinking, and also have “Why and Why-not” mindset. Skills and ability to uncover insights through data analytics, identity errors or unexpected trends. Good network with the external data-community to understand the trend and continuously challenge the internal by outside in thinking. Detailed oriented, expected to ensure highest level of quality / rigor in reports & data analysis. Team oriented, resilient, collaborative, diplomatic and flexible style, with the ability to tailor data driven results to different stakeholders. Ability to work unsupervised or with minimal guidance, and efficiently designing, implementing, and documenting own processes to ensure high quality work. Ability to work effectively under pressure and time constraints in a fast-paced, rapidly evolving environment. Good knowledge in Microsoft operating systems and programs including Office 365, One Drive, Teams. Good knowledge of project management to ensure successful project delivery.

jobs.title: Data Scientist
jobs.location: Downtown Core, Central Singapore Community Development Council, Singapore
jobs.about_us: Founded by CEO Vikas Garg in 2018, our mission is to mobilise a billion people to save the world, by making better choices for the planet. The abillion app, available in 173 countries worldwide, is quickly becoming the super app for sustainability. To date, we’ve helped more than 1 million members discover, shop and review sustainable options from consumer products companies and restaurants globally. Through our unique giving program, abillion has donated over US $2 million to create impact for animals, children and the environment. www.abillion.com
jobs.job_description: The Data team at abillion is looking to hire a Data Scientist to harness the wealth of data on our platform with Analytics and Artificial Intelligence techniques. The ultimate goal is to improve user experience, accelerate business growth, and eliminate internal inefficiencies. The Data team’s role is to design, develop, and deploy data models, leverage data insights to power critical business and product decisions, and produce high quality research for the plant-based investment community. This is an exciting and challenging role that involves cross-team collaboration with Growth, Marketing and Engineering teams. You can expect to work on high impact projects, and should be prepared to move fast and adapt quickly. Responsibilities Reporting into the VP of Data, this role will be responsible for a number of Data initiatives across functions: Build and deploy models using various techniques for information extraction Leverage Data to evaluate feature performance, influence product decisions to drive engagement, conversion, churn and more Build data solutions to enhance user experience such as personalization and recommendations across multiple channels Deliver KPI dashboards Perform rigorous data analysis and leverage data viz techniques to publish deep-dive research reports based on platform data.
jobs.job_requirements: Ideally, you: are currently a Data Scientist, delivering creative Data Science solutions. have top notch technical skills in Python/R having delivered in a few of the following areas: Deep Learning, Machine Learning, Data Viz, NLP, Exposure to various tools and cloud infrastructure. enjoy being a team player, with the ability to collaborate with multiple stakeholders. care passionately about sustainability have at a minimum a Bachelor's or Masters degree in Computer Science/Information Technology/Engineering/Business Analytics have at least 5 years of relevant experience in Data Science.

jobs.title: Senior Data Analyst
jobs.about_us: My clients are a really exciting global company who are growing significantly to meet the rising demand for their product. They are looking for Data Analysts at Mid and Senior Level positions to come in and join their growing team. The successful candidate must be able to derive real business value from the data and be able to present this to various stakeholders to fulfill their needs. Excellent communication is a key skill for this role. You must also have good skills in SQL and be experienced in Python and be experienced in at least 1 Data Visualisation tool.
jobs.job_description:
Responsibilities

- Work closely with various business units to understand their needs and requirements from a data perspective and then use the Data to find actionable results.
- Be able to work on own initiative and create projects from scratch with minimal guidance from others.
- Deliver impactful insights and recommendations using compelling visualisations in user-friendly dashboard designs.
- Be responsible for optimising the team's data process and providing guidance to other members of the team and organisation.
- Work with other teams to ensure the data pipelines, align with broader company needs.
jobs.job_requirements:
Requirements

- 4+ years experience in a Data Analyst or Business Intelligence role
- Good skills in SQL in order to extract and manipulate data
- Experience in at least 1 Data Visualisation tool (Tableau / Power BI / Qlikview)
- Record of delivering tangible business outcomes from data
- Excellent communication and stakeholder management must be able to communicate with stakeholders around the globe and understand their needs and requirements then be able to offer possible solutions
- Be able to discuss data pipeline needs with Engineers at a strategic level

jobs.title: Social Insight Analyst - Contract
jobs.about_us: Salt is seeking bilingual (English and Thai) and capable Social Listening Insight Analyst for a minimum of 12-months to work within the wider team helping to unlock key insights to drive growth, and present your actionable recommendations to key stakeholders directly.
jobs.job_description:
12-month+ freelance contract
Paid on a day rate
Fully remote working
Working London hours - 14:00pm - 22:00pm local time

You will:
-- Work closely with the wider insights team to translate internal briefs into analytical projects, and conduct analysis using a range of in-house tools to derive actionable insights
-- Work across a range of digital touchpoints, including social listening/analytics
-- Provide qualitative and quantitative analysis and insight to inform brand and marketing strategy, digital marketing content, communications, and new product development
-- Build and test queries on in-house tools, and create well-crafted visualisations, primarily in PowerPoint
jobs.job_requirements:
You will need:
-- To be able to speak English and Thai proficiently
-- Experience working in digital insights, with strong experience in social listening
-- Exposure to a range of tools, including Google Analytics and Brandwatch

jobs.title: Data Scientist - Neuroscientist
jobs.about_us: Biofourmis is looking for smart and capable Data Scientist on our Data Science team to join our ranks. The ideal candidate should have the passion to use healthcare data and advanced machine learning techniques to build services to patients and caregivers. We are building an end-to-end service that integrates seamlessly into the lives of those patients via multiple touchpoints on front-end while providing intelligent analytics on the backend.
jobs.job_description: Responsibilities: • Analyze complex medical problems by referring to a patient’s history, examining them and conducting neurological tests. • Monitor the behavioral and cognitive side effects of treatment and medication; Interpret the results of neuroimaging studies. • Get involved in developing machine learning model to track patient sleep disorders, neuroimmunology, neuro-oncology, behavioral neurology and neurogenetics. • Documentation which clearly explains how algorithms have been implemented, verified and validated.
jobs.job_requirements: Experience / Training: • Hands on experience in monitoring the behavioral and cognitive side effects of treatment and medication; Hands on experience in interpret the results of neuroimaging studies. • Hands on experience in machine learning model to track patient sleep disorders, neuroimmunology, neuro-oncology, behavioral neurology and neurogenetics. Education: • Master or PhD in Neuroscience or related fields with strong research ability and coding skills.
skills: Specialize In One Part Of The Nervous System, Such As Neurotransmitters, Or Focus Their Research On Specific Behaviors, Such As Psychiatric Disorders. Illnesses Based In The Nervous System Include Alzheimer’S, Parkinson’S, Multiple Sclerosis, Sleep Disorder.
Hands On Experience With Octave/ Python/ R
Have Experience In Physiological Data (E.G. Eeg /Ecg/ Ppg/ Accelerometer) Or Electronic Health Record (Ehr) System.
Good Research Ability And Critical Thinking Skills, Publication On Top Journal Is A Bonus.
Excellent Written And Verbal Communication Skills.

jobs.title: Lead Data Scientist (FinTech/ East)
jobs.about_us: My client is looking for a highly-motivated person to lead the Data Science Team and support in developing cutting edge fraud and risk management solutions.
jobs.job_description:
Responsibilities
Lead the development and validation of high-impact statistical and machine learning quantitative models used to enhance product features and solutions of real-world issues
Contribute to product design and architecture planning of major systems and features
Guide and mentor a multi-disciplined Data Science and Data Engineering team to forge a research-oriented and collaborative culture through innovative technology implementation at scale
Work in a fast-paced environment with tight deliverable timeframes and able to communicate effectively with multiple stakeholders
jobs.job_requirements:
Requirements
Seven or more years of relevant work experience (including at least one year of exposure to payments, banking or FinTech)
BSc, Masters, PhD, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, etc.)
Advanced knowledge of statistical and machine learning models: Logistic Regression, Support Vector Machines, random forests, XGBoost, Deep Learning models (CNNs/RNNs)
Proficient in big data computing skills: scikit-learn in Python, Pandas, Hadoop, Spark, SQL, etc.
Proficiency in using Amazon Web Services
Proficiency in using any graph databases: Neo4J, ArangoDB, AllegroGraph, JanusDB, etc.
Additional advantage with proficiency in Natural Language Processing
Additional advantage with proficiency in using Keras, TensorFlow, Caffe, Torch/PyTorch, Spark MLlib, or any other Deep Learning framework
Track record in leading data science projects and delivering from end-to-end.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to convey your message to team members and other stakeholders

jobs.title: Data Scientist
jobs.about_us: A dynamic opportunity for a skilled Data Scientist to join a flexible, remote team supporting data-driven decision-making across product, marketing, and engineering teams. This role focuses on collecting and analyzing complex datasets, building predictive models, and developing visualizations that guide business strategy. Ideal for candidates who are comfortable working independently, love problem-solving, and are passionate about data science and analytics innovation.
jobs.job_description:
Responsibilities
- Collect, clean, and analyze large and complex datasets from various sources
- Develop predictive models and machine learning algorithms to support business decisions
- Create dashboards and visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., product, marketing, engineering) to implement data-driven solutions
- Conduct A/B testing and experimentation to measure the impact of product and business changes
- Interpret and present data findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences
- Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in data science and analytics
jobs.job_requirements:
Requirements
- Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field
- Proven experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar analytical role
- Proficiency in Python, R, or SQL
- Strong knowledge of statistical analysis, machine learning, and data mining techniques
- Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Matplotlib/Seaborn
- Familiarity with big data platforms (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) is a plus
- Excellent problem-solving, communication, and collaboration skills

Preferred Qualifications:
- Microsoft SQL database experience
- Experience deploying models into production environments

jobs.title: Scientist
jobs.about_us: Synthomer hiring Scientist in Kulai, Johore, Malaysia | LinkedIn Skip to main content LinkedIn Scientist in Kuala Lumpur Expand search This button displays the currently selected search type. When expanded it provides a list of search options that will switch the search inputs to match the current selection. jobs.job_description: Main Accountabilities: a) To bring creativity and innovation to problem solving and idea generation in pursuing novel solutions to the H&P new product innovation program, developing polymers for our markets in line with our strategy on sustainability b) Serve as project leader for research in strategic areas and complex R&D projects; designs and executes investigation plans around complex problems that involves more than one area of specialization; communicate all lab results and project reports to superior; and work closely with Technical Service, Operations Improvement Team, Commercial, Production, Regulatory Affairs and Marketing team meeting timelines and resources constraints. c) Proactively identifies new opportunities for technical/research projects, propose technical projects which will enhance Synthomer business performance, and lead the investigation and evaluation of the feasibility for potential products and process improvements, as well as write patents and develop IP strategies to protect our products and know-how. d) Develop new products/formulation based on customer/market needs provided by SBU with defined projects, actively exploring chances of converting new technologies into commercial products and supporting current product troubleshooting (about 70%, 20% & 10% of working time respectively). e) To be aware and adhere to the overall SHE & quality policies of the company. Expected Deliverable: Creative and novel solutions leading to new products for the H&P market which enhance the company’s business in line with it’s strategy and sustainability targets. Other Responsibilities: f) To identify, report on and improve safety related issues in immediate working environment using available tools and systems. g) Conduct competitors’ patent monitoring in Intellectual Property landscape h) To develop training programs for lab personnel by advising and consulting in the areas of expertise; give technical direction for chemists who are doing work in related projects.
jobs.job_requirements: Minimum Requirements: PhD Degree in emulsion related area with good knowledge of polymer synthesis 5 years’ experience in R&D industrial emulsion polymerization. Ability to demonstrate creative independent research using current best practices, analytical tools and external resources. Publications and patents related to the synthesis of polymer is a plus. Desirable Skill / Knowledge Polymer science, materials science, emulsion polymerisation, chemistry, IT skills Competency Innovative mindset, creativity, out of the box thinking, complex problem solving, curiosity, generates imaginative ideas and solutions

jobs.title: Data Scientist
jobs.job_description:
Responsibilities
- Collect, clean, and analyze large and complex datasets from various sources.
- Develop predictive models and machine learning algorithms to support business decisions.
- Create dashboards and visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., product, marketing, engineering) to implement data-driven solutions.
- Conduct A/B testing and experimentation to measure the impact of product and business changes.
- Interpret and present data findings in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical audiences.
- Stay up to date with the latest trends and technologies in data science and analytics.
jobs.job_requirements:
Requirements
- Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
- Proven experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar analytical role.
- Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.
- Strong knowledge of statistical analysis, machine learning, and data mining techniques.
- Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Matplotlib/Seaborn.
- Familiarity with big data platforms (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) is a plus.
- Excellent problem-solving, communication, and collaboration skills.

Preferred Qualifications:
- Microsoft SQL database experience
- Bachelors degree in data science or related experience.
- Experience deploying models into production environments.

jobs.title: Artificial Intelligence Architect
jobs.about_us: We are seeking a highly skilled and innovative AI Architect to lead the design, development, and deployment of advanced AI solutions across the APAC region. This role focuses on leveraging Azure AI Foundry, Copilot, LLMs, and Azure Machine Learning services to build scalable, secure, and high-performance AI systems. You will play a key role in shaping AI strategy, building intelligent agents, and integrating cutting-edge technologies into real-world applications.
jobs.job_description:
Key Responsibilities:
- Architect and implement AI models using Azure AI Foundry, Copilot, LLMs, and Azure ML services.
- Design and scale AI platforms incorporating RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), LLMs, and ML pipelines.
- Develop intelligent AI agents using open standards (e.g., MCP, A2A) and Multi-Agent System principles.
- Collaborate with engineering teams to ensure best practices in AI deployment, security, and performance optimization.
- Partner with clients to translate business needs into robust, scalable AI solutions.
- Ensure seamless integration with Azure Cognitive Services, OpenAI models, and vector databases (e.g., Azure AI Search, FAISS, CosmosDB, Pinecone).
jobs.job_requirements:
Required Qualifications:
- Proven experience with Azure AI Foundry, Copilot, and its ecosystem.
- Strong background in LLM fine-tuning, RAG, and AI-driven application development.
- Proficiency in Python and ML frameworks such as PyTorch and TensorFlow.
- Hands-on experience with Azure Cognitive Services, OpenAI APIs, and vector search technologies.
- Deep understanding of AI security, MLOps, and deploying scalable AI solutions.
- Ability to troubleshoot, optimize, and monitor AI models for performance and accuracy.

Preferred Skills:
